FuncDef:
The force-broadcast time command configures a forcible broadcast period for an ERPS ring. When a fast traffic switchover occurs on the ERPS ring, traffic is broadcast during the configured period.
The undo force-broadcast time command restores the default forcible broadcast period of an ERPS ring.
By default, forcible broadcast period is 15s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a forcible broadcast period.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 30 in seconds. The value 0 indicates that forcible broadcast is disabled. The default value is 15s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a fast traffic switchover occurs on an ERPS ring, traffic is forcibly broadcast. In this way, the traffic can be quickly switched to the desired link, meeting the performance requirements of fast switching. However, broadcast storms may occur. In this case, run the force-broadcast time command to configure a forcible broadcast period as needed to prevent broadcast storms occuring.
